content: This PDF appears to be a compilation of various articles or chapters on topics related to the Indian Constitution and legal system. The articles cover a range of topics such as financial control, the role of the upper house, judicial activism, equality, freedom of speech, life and personal liberty, administrative law, delegated legislation, natural justice, federalism, public interest litigation, liability of the administration in tort and contract, and classification of administrative action. The articles are presented in a brief overview format, providing an introduction to each topic and highlighting its key features and principles.
Art. 21 of our Constitution guarantees what?
Art. 21 of our Constitution guarantees right to life and personal liberty.
I'm sorry, but I need more context to provide a helpful answer. Can you please provide more information about what you are asking for details on?

Article 21 of the Indian Constitution guarantees life and personal liberty to all citizens. This includes freedom of speech, assembly, association, movement, residence and profession. The right to privacy is also considered a part of this article. However, these rights are subject to reasonable restrictions in the interest of public order, morality or national security.
